[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: MerkleTreeInternalNode::hash()] [Hasher panics] What happens if the hasher implementation panics during update() or finish() - can this crash validators? (Medium)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: SparseMerkleLeafNode::calc_hash()] [Redundant computation] Why does calc_hash() exist separately from hash() - can inconsistent results between the two cause verification failures? (Low)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Struct: MerkleTreeInternalNode] [PhantomData safety] Does PhantomData<H> correctly enforce type safety, or can type coercion attacks substitute different hashers at runtime? (Medium)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Struct: SparseMerkleLeafNode] [Derive macros] Do the derived traits (CryptoHasher, Debug, Eq, PartialEq, Serialize, Deserialize) maintain security invariants, or can they expose internal state unsafely? (Low)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [Lifetime management] Are all references properly lifetime-bounded to prevent use-after-free when ledger_info or transaction_info are deallocated? (Medium)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: MerkleTreeInternalNode::new()] [Ownership] Does new() take ownership of left_child and right_child by value, preventing mutation after node creation? (Low)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [Proof length attack] Can an attacker provide an extremely long proof with excessive siblings, causing memory exhaustion or timeout during verification? (Medium)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [Short proof attack] Can a proof with insufficient siblings pass verification by exploiting default values or placeholder hashes? (High)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Struct: MerkleTreeInternalNode] [Subtree substitution] Can an attacker replace an entire subtree by finding a different subtree with the same root hash through collision attacks? (Critical)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Struct: SparseMerkleLeafNode] [Leaf forgery] Can an attacker forge a leaf node by computing the preimage of a target hash, inserting arbitrary state into the tree? (Critical)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [Accumulator root manipulation] Can the transaction_accumulator_hash in ledger_info be manipulated without breaking BFT consensus signatures? (Critical)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [State divergence] If two validators compute different transaction_info.hash() for the same transaction due to non-determinism, can both pass verification? (Critical)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Struct: SparseMerkleLeafNode] [Key uniqueness] Does the sparse Merkle tree enforce key uniqueness, or can multiple leaves with the same key but different value_hash coexist? (High)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Type: TransactionAccumulatorInternalNode] [Accumulator append-only] Does the accumulator structure enforce append-only semantics, or can transactions be inserted out of order? (Critical)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: SparseMerkleLeafNode::hash()] [Value commitment] Does the value_hash commit to the entire account state, or can partial state be hidden while still producing valid proofs? (High)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [Verification complexity] What is the computational complexity of proof verification, and can attackers force O(n) verification times with adversarial proofs? (Medium)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: MerkleTreeInternalNode::hash()] [Hash computation cost] Can repeated hashing be exploited to cause validator CPU exhaustion during proof verification? (Low)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Struct: SparseMerkleLeafNode] [Memory footprint] Can attackers create proofs with excessive leaf nodes, causing memory exhaustion on validators? (Medium)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Type alias: TransactionAccumulatorProof] [Type substitution] Can TransactionAccumulatorProof be accidentally used where EventAccumulatorProof is expected, breaking verification logic? (High)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Derive: Serialize for SparseMerkleLeafNode] [Deserialization validation] Does deserialization validate that the reconstructed node has consistent hash properties? (High)
[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Type alias: TestAccumulatorInternalNode] [Test type leakage] Can TestOnlyHasher be enabled in production, using a weaker hash function for real proofs? (High)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Struct: MerkleTreeInternalNode] [Tree balance] Can unbalanced Merkle trees with degenerate structures pass validation, affecting proof size and verification time? (Medium)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: MerkleTreeInternalNode::hash()] [Subtree depth] Does the hash include subtree depth information, or can shallow and deep subtrees with the same leaves produce identical hashes? (High)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Struct: SparseMerkleLeafNode] [Sparse tree coverage] In a sparse Merkle tree with few leaves, can attackers exploit empty subtrees to create short invalid proofs? (Medium)

[File: types/src/proof/mod.rs] [Function: verify_transaction_info()] [Version spoofing] Can an attacker claim transaction_version is lower than actual to prove an older state, hiding recent transactions? (High)
